name: Tag and Bag
description: it's awful

name: WitRD Draft
description: Ice Analyzer -> Woman in the Red Dress

name: Liens Compromis
description: This is a revisited version of my deck "Linked to the past". This deck is focused on links and compromised employee. With all that links and rec credit for trace, you'll be good against nbn and weyland. Replicator can do great jobs here, in order to install 2 hq or rd interface, 3 Dyson chip in a row. I will see if i keep it or not. I got only 6 events, i think that eureka can be really nice here. I have think to also add hostage, to have all my compromised emp or to have the econom i need.

name: Replicating the Dew 2 Electric boogaloo
Weyland_0TKO
ZuFaeRush
description:
I replaced Cyber-Cypher + Tinkering with ZU13 + Indexing. That lets me apply pressure on every server even with no Tinkering in grip. Also ZU13 passes Datapike/Enigma for 3, 1 credit more than Cyber-Cypher. Not that big a deal.

Also, no ProContact because too expensing. Replaced by 3x Diesel.

Install your complete rig for 3 credits and go to town. Play the lone Magnum Opus when you're set up only.

For instant cash, Sure Gamble & Dirty Laundry. For fast cash, Daily Cast. For slow cash, Magnum Opus.

Against big ice, use and reuse Crescentus. When R&D costs too much, play the lone Escher.

name: Weyland_OTK
description: Strategy? • Go fishing for : - Jackson Howard - Power Shutdown - Accelerated Diagnostics • Have 10 credits more than the runner • Wait for the runner to run • Play JH • Play Power Shutdown (mill the whole deck) • Use JH to recycle SEA Source , Scorched x2 • ??? • PROFIT!!!

name: Scavenger (pre mala)
description:
Femme is one fun card. Want a deck centered on abusing her? Here you go. The scavenge/test run combo makes her cheap, and the econ is set up to pump out lots of credits if you need to save the test run for another breaker. Same old thing means you really have 5 of either combo piece, or 4 stimhacks or shutdowns.

The rest of the deck is fairly straightforward; anti scorch, an r&d dig win-con, econ, and a few tricks besides femme to really mess with the corp. Omni-drive is a backup to the toolbox, not as good but much cheaper - you might want that memory for magnum and cyber-cyphers though.

Any playtesting comments welcome.

name: Psycho Gods vHJ2.0
description: My version of db0 excellent Psycho Gods build. I've gone with Ichi 1.0 over any 2.0 because the 2.0 isn't strong enough. 1.0 will trash programs just fine and the trace is just icing if the runner hits it poorer than you...if they're running spinal modem like one opponent did wednesday...even better. :) Data raven over shadow because I like the money but mimic breaks it unless you invest 3 creds and clicks advancing whereas Data raven is far more effective overall imo. Forcing the runner to shake tags or accumulate for your psychographics score is win/win for you. I also went with 3/2 agendas for never advance. With 12 assets, your opponent never knows if it's an agenda or another campaign/JackHo. I lose the PSF/EFF Comm combo but I (or you) can always switch out -3 agendas (one each of mandatory upgrades, project vitruvious, ABT) for +3 PSF if you want it. Play tested Wednesday against local players and went 4/5. 80% win rate is pretty awesome. Local players were playtesting decks but all were solid builds and the players were strong, no gimmes. Thanks again to db0 for a fun build and Octgn. :)

name: Rielle's Headlock
description: Rielle Cyber Cypher deck with a little help from my little friend Atman. Chose to use Scavenge instead of Modded, since costs are not that high to need it and Cipher remapping is vital here. Omni-drive over mem chips because it pays for itself and allows one more chance a turn to run with Cipher, leaving me room to play with my tricks.

name: 50 shades of grey and black
description:
high trash cost assets help create a credit gap for you to alter the runners board state by using black and grey ops. Gimmicky but with practice could be tuned to be quite the pain in the ass. PGO clears out carapaces and consoles. IoP can be done before a scorched if you score off a breaking news.

I'd like to put in 2 Sea Source to punish asset trashing, following it up with a scorched (doesn't even have to be lethal) or freelance.

I'm not sure what effect altering the runner's board state will have, and how to exploit it to the max. Basically, a lot of this can make power shut down more effective.

Thoughts?

name: Deep Whiz (Trashing)
description: This deck sets up really fast, steals money, forces the corp to throw away expensive ice and then gives me credits when they try to recover. Undefeated in five games. Looking to build this into a tournament deck and looking for feedback.

name: Noise: Virus Swarm v1.02
description: -2 Vamp

name: Replicating the Dew 3 Revenge of the Dew
Deep Whiz 2.0
description: got rid of one account siphon to add clone chips to save knights. dropped bishops for an extra deja, datasucker and corroder

name: Chaos_ctr
Homeless Guy Chess in the Park rev 2
description: Other version was -3 scavenge, -3 dinosaurus -2 atman -1 gordian -1 pipeline, +3 toolbox +3 UWC +1 snowball, +1 zu.13, +1 creeper unsure what is better, this one is more flexible.

name: News Flash! v.6
Chaos Monolith T1000
description: This deck tries to put out a monolith as quickly as possible. With this deck you cycle through the deck a couple times. The first time you go through the deck you are looking for economy. Then Levy AR to go through the deck again for programs and your rig, if it is not out after the first pass. Try to have Freelance contract in your opening hand. -This is my first published deck. Please comment about what you think I should improve on or think about.
